Essay: For a tip speed ratio of 7.2, both three-blade and two-blade turbines will yield the same power coefficient (about 0.375). This is because the three blade has passed its optimum working condition and is starting to decline its power coefficient in terms of tip speed ratio. Disregarding the physical strength and risk of damage, the three-blade wind turbine is better because the graph shows that for a small number of blades, the tip of the blade needs to move faster in order to reach the same value for the power coefficient. This is of course less efficient than if you had more blades. Rotating machinery is also more prone to damage.
